Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	 "Thus begin the words of Avicenna.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	 "Oh, children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, and by completing it its end is achieved, and by its expositions, and by its explanations, it seems to me that I complete it for you with this treatise, which is a part of the operation with the hand, that is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	 "For the operation with the hand is rejected in our region and in our time of all privation, until very little remains of its science, and its traces are erased; and nothing remains of it except some small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which have changed the most and have become errors and confusions, to the point that their intentions are closed and its power and art are weakened.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	 "And it seems to me that I revive it with the organization of this treatise according to the way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that it comes with the forms of the cautery tools and the other instruments of the work as it is by addition of the declaration, and for its preparation, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	 This text discusses the difficulty of finding a good physician in the present time due to the length and complexity of medical training. It emphasizes that to be proficient in medicine, one must have extensive knowledge of anatomy, including the structure and function of various body parts, their connections and separations, and the number and arrangement of bones, nerves, sinews, and blood vessels (both pulsatile and quiet ones). The author also mentions the importance of understanding the places where these vessels emerge. Here's a line-by-line translation:
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	 And for that reason, Hippocrates said that it is not just a word, but small in name and greater in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	 But we have already spoken of that in the introduction to this book; for whoever is not knowledgeable about what we have said about anatomy will fall into error by which men die, as I have seen happen too often, because some are trained in this science and then cast it aside without knowledge or experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	 For I saw a foolish and inexperienced physician cut into an ulcerous abscess on the neck of a woman, and he also cut some arteries in the neck, causing a great deal of blood to flow until the woman fell dead into his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	 And I saw another physician who attempted to remove a stone from a man who had developed an issue in his bladder; the stone was large, and it came out with a piece of the bladder, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	 And I myself was called to extract it, and I saw that because of the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, I knew for certain that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	 And I saw another physician who took payment of a duc from our land for surgery, and he treated a negro castrato who had a fracture in his thigh; and the physician, with his ignorance, extracted the fracture through the wound with cushions and bandages with strong compression, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	 And then you unbind him according to his wishes, and then you rebinding him, and then you leave him dry for several days, and command that we do not bind the bandage; and this way we proceed until the swelling in his foot is abated, and it reaches a state of healing.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	 And I was called to him, and prepared to unbind the bandage, and thus his tranquility was achieved, and similarly he admitted to his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	 But since the corruption was already confirmed in the member, and it could not be restrained, and ceased to spread the corruption in the member until the patient perished.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	 And I saw another physician who punctured a cancerous swelling, and it became ulcerated after several days, until the evil of it was increased by the lord of him.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	 The reason for this is that the black cancer is entirely of melancholic humors, and it is not necessary to have iron in all parts, but rather in the member which feels all of it.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	 And therefore, my sons, it is necessary for you that the operation with the hand should be carried out in two ways: one is an operation associated with health, and another is a work involving great risk in the greatest dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	 And I have already mentioned this in every place of this book where an operation is performed that involves error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to watch out for this and avoid it, so that the pages do not find a way to speak and dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	 And therefore, take up your weapons with care and under the protection of God, and your patients with happiness and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	 And use the best way with God's grace for them to attain health and praiseworthy success, and avoid the terrible diseases of difficult healing, and keep your weapons away from what causes you fear, so that doubt in your faith and in your name does not elude you: for it is more beneficial to your glory, and both now and later, to your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	 I have already said this in some of my previous works:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	 "Do not treat evil patients, lest you be called evil doctors.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	 And I have already divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	 Here begins the division of the book, and first of the first chapter.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	 The first chapter concerns the head, specifically the forms of instruments and the irons of the cautery, and what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	 "The division of the second section.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	 "The second chapter, on cupping and incision, and on cupping glasses, and on wounds, and on the extraction of arrows and similar things, all categorized and arranged according to the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	 "Division of the third section.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	 "The third chapter, on reduction and dislocation, and on the treatment of fractures and similar conditions; a chapter arranged from the head to the feet, and on the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	 "On cautery with fire and with sharp medicine, and on remembering the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	 "With this begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	 "I want to say what are the advantages and disadvantages of that type of cautery, and in which circumstances it is forbidden.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	 "So I say that the discussion about the advantages and disadvantages of cautery is a long and complex discourse, subtle in its knowledge and secretly hidden; and many wise men have spoken about it, and they disagree among themselves, and only a little of their discussions reaches me, fearing to be too lengthy.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	 "And therefore I say that you should perform cautery in every circumstance, whether it involves matter or not, except for two circumstances, which are cold and dry conditions without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	 In this case of cold and dry illness with matter, it is necessary to remember; because some say that cautery is helpful for that, while others say the opposite of that, that cautery is not suitable for an illness caused by quality and dryness, because the nature of fire is heat and dryness, and it is inappropriate that a cold and dry illness be healed with something hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	 Say the opposite of that, that through cautery there is improvement in all cold and dry illnesses that occur in men's bodies, because when you compare a man's body and its humidity to the nature of fire, you find the man's body to be cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	 And I say by the words of that, that experience has revealed this to me many times before.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	 However, it is not necessary to discuss this matter further with someone who has already been instructed and practiced in the chapter on cautery through previous practice, and who knows the diversity of men's constitutions, the disposition of their illnesses within them, the causes of those illnesses, their accidents, and the time course of those illnesses.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	 But in other constitutions, there is no need to fear, and especially in cold and moist illnesses, because all physicians have agreed on these, and they are not disagreed upon in the improvement with cautery in those cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	 And know, children, that the secret of treatment through cautery with fire and its goodness lies in that the fire is simple, the action of which only reaches the member that is being cauterized, and it does no harm to the other members connected to it except for a small injury.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	 But the action of medicine cautery reaches those members that are close to it, and it easily brings about difficult healing in the sick member and is quickly applied.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	 But fire, due to its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, does nothing but burn away superfluous matter. And it is known to us through experience and the long service of study in this art concerning the truth of causes; and for that reason I am excused from the length of this discourse. And if it were not that it is not written in my book, here I would reveal to you a secret hidden with fire, and the quality of its operation on bodies and its expulsion by which diseases are expelled, demonstrated with philosophical reasoning, which would be suitable for your intellects.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	 And know, children, that they disagree about the time in which it is suitable to perform cautery and they establish the best time as spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	 And I say that cauterization is appropriate at all times, because the damage from an accidental moment is submerged in the help of what is drawn with the cautery, and especially if the cauterization is for painful or necessary pains, forces, and fistulas, which do not tolerate delay, lest something worse should come from them, which is greater than a minor injury entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	 And this is what is in your minds, or sons, that only the common people and foolish doctors think so, since the illness that is cured by cauterization does not return at all times, and they claim that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	 And the reason is not as they think, because cauterization is only used in places where medicine alters the complexion and dries up the moisture that causes pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	 However, cauterization exceeds medicine in effectiveness due to its strength and the power of its operation, as well as the greatness of its practitioner.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	 And it is possible that their illness may return at some point in time, depending on the patient's complexion and the location of their illness, as well as the patient's strength and what has been prepared in their body from the accumulation of superfluidities, and what they have acquired through their diet and similar causes. However, if the illness for which cauterization is administered is a subtle illness in a member with few superfluities and moisture, such as cautery for toothache and the like, it is possible that the pain will not return in them, but this is done rarely.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	 And it is commonly said that cautery is the last resort of medicine, and this is a true statement, as I understand it, because I believe there is no cure that can be achieved with medicine or any other means except through cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	 And the reason is contrary to this; and the intention that cautery is the last resort of medicine is only when the ways of cure are administered in certain illnesses, and those medicines do not succeed, and then at the end of the cause one administers cautery, and it benefits in this.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	 And from here, I conclude that cautery is the last resort of medicine, not according to the intention which I understand from the common people and too many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	 And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they said this not for any other reason than for the equality of gold and the nobility of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	 And they said that the place of cautery does not burn, as if this were absolutely true. For I have proven and found that this is not so in all bodies, but only in some without others, and cautery with it is good and better than with iron as they said; however, when you make cautery with fire with gold, it is not declared to you, because it is ignited according to the quantity that you want by the roughness of the gold, and because it prepares to receive a burn. And if you put a fire on it, the gold melts from the heat, and some sheets fall into the fire by which the craftsman loses his occupation.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	 Here's my attempt at translating that line into English:
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	 Here is the translation of the given text into English:
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	 "On treating headaches caused by coldness and dampness.
Le capitol primier.	 "The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	 "This cauterization treats coldness and dampness in the body, which are the two causes of many ailments. It is effective against headaches, excessive earwax, persistent yawning, toothaches, sore throats, and generally any illness caused by coldness, such as paralysis, fever, stroke, and similar conditions.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	 "The method for this cauterization is as follows: firstly, instruct the patient to take a laxative medication to cleanse the bowels for three or four nights, depending on the patient's strength, age, and habits.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	 "And then instruct them to shave their head with a razor. Then have that person sit between your hands on a low bench, and have them place their feet on the ground.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	 "Then place the sharp edge of your palm close to the bridge of the nose between the patient's eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	 "However, when your finger reaches the middle of the forehead, mark that spot with a needle. Then heat the cautery stick, which should be olive-shaped like this:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	 And then you place it on the affected area with a tent, in such a way that it descends, and with which the left hand is gently pressed, little by little, and you turn it over.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	 And then you lift your hand slightly and look at the area, and if you see any part of the bone already exposed, even as small as a grain of millet, then raise your hand. But if not, return your hand with that iron, or another one like it, until the bone is visible as I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	 And then take a little salt and dissolve it in water, and leave it on the area for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	 And then place on it a cloth soaked in vinegar and leave it on the area until the scab of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	 And then treat the area with Tetrapharmakon ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	 And they say that the more open the wound remains, the better the arm gets, because it is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	 And some of them say that the tendon should be cauterized up to the bone, and that the cautery should be held there until a piece of the bone's appearance is burnt.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	 And immediately remove that which is adjacent to the bone, and immediately treat it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	 And others say that with the cautery one should reach to the very back, until it presses strongly on the bone, to the point that the bone breaks, and this is the form of a small operation.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	 And they believe that from that place the vapors of the head are released.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	 And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and then it should be treated until it is healed.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	 But I have not seen these two types of cautery in all cases, only in some men due to fear; and that one, I think, is better with health than without it, because the head is opened by solving its continuity just as we have shown in other members, especially when the patient's head is of a frail nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	 And the first type of cautery is safer and better in my opinion, and with that one works and performs the task healthily.
Capitol segon.	 Chapter two.
Del cauteri del cap.	 On the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	 When persistent and prolonged pain occurs in the entire head of a patient who has used poultices, plasters, head purges, ointments, lotions, caps, helmets, hoods, and similar remedies, especially if it has already been cauterized with a cautery that did not benefit him at all from those causes, then consider whether the patient's head is of strong creation in its nature; and is not frail and finds great cold, then that one should be cauterized again with another cautery near that one a little.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	 And then cauterize that area on the horn of his head with a pointed cautery until the caul is cut off.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	 Cut the caul and expose the bone in the amount we've measured. Cauterize that area with a pointed cautery on the back part of the head in the place called the 'vas', which is where the cupping glass is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	 And be gentle in doing this, and do not expose the bone, for the patient will find great pain from this, different from the pain of all other head cauteries.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	 And I say that this cautery should be in its place, for the cautery with which you cauterize the horns of the head and the occiput is more delicate than the one used to cauterize the middle part of the head; and this is its shape.

De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	 On Cauterizing Ear Pain

De cauterizacio de turtura.	 "On the Cauterization of Torture
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	 "Torture that is cured and can be treated with cauterization is only from the toxins that come through phlegm, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.

E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	 "And place your cautery against the opposite side of the affected part, because softening only occurs in the area that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	 "And the method of cauterization is to cauterize with a cautery on the right side of the tip of the ear, slightly higher than the horn of the head, and another on the temple, whose length should be according to the length of the thumb, and hold your hand with the cautery until the amount equivalent to half the thickness of the little finger is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	 And this is the form of the cautery, which is like a small knife, the shape of which is placed in front of the table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	 However, it must be more subtle than that one, somewhat like a needle; and it is necessary to remove some of its excess thickness.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	 Then care for the area with water until it has healed.

Capitol .xix.	 "Chapter XIX
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	 "On Cauterizing a Fistula in the Mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat. Capitol .xx.	 Chapter 20
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	 On the Cauterization of Teeth and the Softening of Veins.

E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	 Then lift your hand and repeat the cautery several times as you wish.

Then have the patient rinse their mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, then stop it, because the decayed tooth is closed and the softened gum is strengthened and the corrupting moisture is dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	 Chapter 21
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	 This phrase appears to describe a medical procedure involving tooth pain. A literal translation could be:
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	 When tooth pain is caused by cold, or there is a splinter or worm, and you do not treat it with medicine, then cauterize the area according to two methods: either cauterize with a cow's hoof or cauterize with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	 Cauterizing with a hoof is done by taking a cow's hoof and burning it in the embers of iron, then take cotton and wrap it around the end of the tent peg, then immerse that wrapped tent peg in the burned hoof, and place it on the painful tooth quickly until it becomes cold.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	 And then repeat this process several times until the power of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	 And if you wish, dip wool or cotton in the aforementioned hoof, and place it on the painful tooth, and place a red-hot iron on top of that until the iron reaches the bottom of the tooth's cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	 However, the cauterization with fire is that you pay attention to the needle of iron or steel, and it should have some thickness in its center so that the sharpness of the fire does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	 And then heat the cautery to the desired shape, and place it on the tooth and hold it with your hand until the cautery is cooled; and do this several times because the pain will diminish either that day or the next day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	 And it is necessary that, by pressing with that cautery, the patient fills his mouth with good drink and holds it for an hour, and then spits it out; and this is the method of cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	 And you should cauterize with whatever extreme measures are possible for you to do.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	 And this is the method of using the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	 Chapter XXII
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	 On the Cauterization of Prolapse
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	 When prolapse is caused by phlegm and cold humors and does not respond to digestion through medicines, and you wish to achieve mild digestion of these [humors], then heat the cautery with the following shape: it has two openings, one for the smoke to exit, and place the burning end on the prolapse once, or twice if necessary, until it reaches the core of the prolapse.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	 And if the prolapse is small, then place the cautery according to the size of the prolapse, and leave it for three days, and then apply a poultice soaked in wine until what has been burned by the fire is removed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	 And then treat it with ointments, compresses, and cloths until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	 And the shape of the needle or the cautery should be conveyed in this manner.
Capitol .xxiii.	 Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	 On cauterizing raw vocal cords and constricting the airway.

E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	 And afterwards care for that part with the water mentioned before until it is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	 Chapter 24
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	 On cauterizing illnesses of the lung and coughing.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent. E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	 If you wish, let your cautery point be with the pointed instrument called "punctum," the form of which should precede in the treatment of earache pain.

Capitol .xxv.	 Chapter 25.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	 On the cautery of the little finger, which is called the "titillus.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	 When the little finger is dislocated due to lubricating moisture and does not remain in place upon its return, you must reduce the dislocation until it returns to normal. Then, by a small movement, it should be dislocated back into place, as we have shown. Therefore, firstly, you must reduce the dislocation. De cauterizacio del stomac.	 Of stomach cautery.

De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	 On the incision of an abscess on the foot with a cautery.

When you want to incise or open an abscess on the foot and you wish to know whether that abscess is in the flesh of the foot or in its tunic, then if it is in the flesh of the foot, the patient will experience heaviness and pain without acuteness.

De cauterizacio de plauresi.	 Of the Cautery of Pleurisy
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	 The ancients used to say that the cautery of the pleura caused by cold humors should be done in this manner: take a long, dry reed from the family of rushes, one that is pointed and thin, like the size of a finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	 And then submerge that (the area) in oil and heat it over the fire, and then cauterize that place with a cautery between the continuation of the clavicle and the neck; and with two small cauteries below, one slightly inclined towards the area under the chin, and with two cauteries on the area that is slightly inclined between the fifth rib and the twelfth, inclined a little towards the back areas; and with another cautery in the middle of the foot; and with another on the stomach, and with three cauteries in the back areas; and with one cautery in the place that is between the two shoulders, and with two cauteries on the sides of the feet, below the cautery that is between the two shoulders.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	 And it should not be that you grasp the cautery with your hand, but rather it should be in the open area of the sheath in plain view.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge. Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	 In this perforation with a cautery, there is fear because one can die immediately if it happens in the place of a fistula that does not heal.

De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	 Of the cauterization for ankle dislocation.

E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	 And the place of the dislocation is found in it which is swollen.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle. E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	 And let the iron be of the same form as in the cautery of the stomach.

Capitol .xli.	 Chapter 41
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	 On Cauterizing the Sciatic Vein
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	 When pain occurs in the ankle area due to cold and dampness, the patient is treated with the water we have mentioned before, and no other remedy should be given, for this treatment is ancient. Therefore, you must first purge the patient of gross humors using either fetid pills or artificial pills; then cauterize the affected area.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	 There are two methods for cauterizing in this case: cauterization with burning medicines or cauterization with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	 According to two well-known methods, one of which involves cauterizing the affected area of the ankle with three triangular cauteries like this; and you should make a good depth with them.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	 The space between each cautery should be the width of the tip of your finger, whether you use an olive-sized or larger cautery.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	 However, sometimes the cauteries should be placed halfway up the shin, because there are four cauteries in total.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	 And if you wish, you can also cauterize with the circular shape used in the treatment of ankle dislocation, ensuring that the circle is continuous and burns the entire circumference.
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	 "And this is the manner of cauterization in hernia when the pain adheres to the ring and does not extend into the scrotum.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	 "But if the pain extends into the scrotum, then cauterize it with two cauteries on the scrotum at the place where you direct the patient, which is the pain; and with one cautery on the testicle for four times a little above the posterior part.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	 "And if you use a lancet for cauterization, then let the depth of the cautery be according to the thickness of the scrotal skin.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	 "And if the patient directs that the pain has extended to the place near the testicles, then cauterize it here where he directs with a cautery for three or four times, or more if needed.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	 "And if the patient directs that the pain is below the anus towards the scrotum, then cauterize it here with a lancet.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	 "And be careful in all cauterization that you do not burn too deeply with the lancet so as to damage nerves or large blood vessels, and thus cause harm or injury to the patient.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	 "And I have seen one or two of those who cauterized on the testicle and burned too deeply, and the foot became swollen until the tumor reached the foot, and it was perforated and completely corrupted.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	 And then there is a sudden release of the stomach, and this is death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	 And if the pain occurs in two parts at once, cauterize each one according to this manner.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	 And the wise men said in the cauterization of water, this is the manner: make a circle of iron, the circumference of which is half a palm; and its holes should be according to the thickness of a finger or less.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	 And inside that circle there should be another third [circle]; and the space between them should be the width of a thumb; and those circles should be open on two sides; and the length of those sticks should be one thumb or two thumbs, and make the edges of iron decently finished on the circles; and this is its shape:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	 Then let it be heated in the fire until it becomes red and starts to throw sparks, and then place it on the watery part, with the patient lying on their side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	 And so cauterize that with three round cauteries at once.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat. De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	 On the Cauterization of Wounds.
