Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	 But if its removal is delayed until it has grown, then consider whether it is hardened, solid, of dark color and with little sensation; then do not touch it with iron because it is a crancous abscess; for many times that which you remove this abscess does great harm to the one on whom it was.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	 And if the abscess is of a tender touch and not of dark color, and if removal is possible in all of it, then evacuate the patient and remove it without fear, and treat the area with that which dries and constricts until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	 Chapter .26.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	 Of the suture of the nose and lips and ear when continuity is broken by wound or similar cause.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	 You should know that when there is a disruption in the continuity of one of these small cartilages, only a few people will benefit from this operation.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	 Therefore, when someone has any of these causes, you should consider if it is a fresh wound with blood, and then join the two lips of the wound with stitches, and then take care that it heals from within.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	 And if the lips of the disrupted continuity are already separated and each is healthy, then it is necessary that you cut off each part of its apparent cord until blood comes out.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	 Then join the two lips with stitches and strengthen them, and sprinkle some dragon's blood powder and trissat on top of them, and place a piece of fine emplastrum or one of the other consolidating emplasters on the powder, and leave it in place for two or three days, then remove it and replace the emplaster, leaving it until the threads are naturally dissolved, and then care for it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	 But the method of stitching is that you bring together the disruption in continuity either with needles as we have described in the stitching of the belly, or bring together the disruption in continuity with thread as you have been taught.
Capitol .xxvii.	 Chapter 27.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	 About the removal of that cause which occurs in the inner lips of the genital area.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	 Often observed in many men inside the lips of their genitals are hard growths resembling pork fat, and some of them are smaller while others are larger.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	 Therefore, you should turn the lips and folds where each of those hard growths is located, and then remove them by cutting them out until the bleeding stops. After that, wash the area with vinegar and treat it with water that has astringent properties until it heals.
Capitol .xxviii.	 Chapter 28.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	 About the incision of the flesh attached to the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	 It is often seen that there is flesh attached to the gums which the ancients called "albulus". Therefore, you should suspend it with a hook or forceps and incise it until it bleeds.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	 Then place on the area some powdered sage or other powders that have astringent or drying properties.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	 And if the flesh returns, then incise it again and cauterize it, because after cautery it will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	 Chapter XXIX
De razo de dentz am ferr.	 Concerning toothache with fever.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	 When the surfaces of both upper and lower teeth, as well as the spaces between them and the gums, are rough, dry, and sometimes blackened or yellowed until the gum becomes corrupt and the teeth loosen.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	 Therefore, it is necessary that you make the patient sit between your hands and place their head on your lap, and scrape the teeth in which those rough areas appear with a tool resembling sand until no cause remains; this will remove the blackness and yellowing and other issues until they are cleaned.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	 If this does not cause the pain to stop as described at the beginning of the condition, then do so again on the next day and the second and third days until it reaches its final state as you wish.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	 And know that teeth require many different tools of various shapes and forms, depending on what is needed for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	 And because the instrument with which the upper tooth is scraped differs from that with which it is scraped between the teeth according to other shapes, and you should prepare these forms of instruments as you will see shortly:

D’eradicacio de dentz.	 "About the removal of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	 "Cover that you cure the tooth of its pain with all skill and delay in all its removal, for there is no reason to replace it when it has been removed, for it is a sublime substance until its extraction.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	 "But when the patient is forced to extract that tooth, you must be firmly certain which one is the painful tooth, for often the pain deceives the patient and it seems to be in a healthy tooth. And if you extract that one, then the pain will not cease until the sick and painful tooth has been extracted, because we have seen this happen through the work of barbers.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	 "Therefore, as you must be certain which is the painful tooth and you know it well, then you should scarify around the tooth with a spatula in which there is some virtue, until it dissolves from the gum on all sides. And afterwards you treat that [area] with your words, or with fine forceps little by little at the beginning until you reach it.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	 "And afterwards, hold him firmly with strong hands for good speech or powerful traction, and place the patient's head between your knees so that he does not move, and then extract the tooth according to its right direction in such a way that you do not break it, nor give the patient greater pain.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	 And so if it is not forgotten, then take one of those instruments and place it under the patient in such a way that all parts are moved with ease and strength, as was done at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	 But if the tooth is cracked or rotten, then you should fill that crack with cloth and tighten it with a thin thread so that it will not break during your pulling with the forceps.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	 And it is necessary that you work meticulously with scraping around the entire circumference of the gum and be careful not to break the tooth so that it remains intact, and return to the patient because the pain will be greater than before.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	 And beware not to do what some ignorant barbers do in their arrogance and audacity regarding the removal of teeth without administering what we have recommended; for many times they bring great troubles upon sick men that are more difficult to heal, and the reasons for this are all, or some of them, or because you extract that tooth along with some bones from the jaw as well, just as we have testified on many occasions.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	 And before removing it, the mouth should be washed with warm water or vinegar and salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	 If there is bleeding through the wound, as if it were many small vessels, then sprinkle some amount of dry powder on the wound and, if the powder does not help, use a cautery.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	 The shape of the forceps and thin tongs with which you begin to extract the tooth should be long at the end, short in handle and thick, so that they are not bent when you have to work with them.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	 And thus the handles should be of such a size that when they are tightened with these, they are not bent, and they should be short at the end.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	 And they should be made of Indian iron, straight at the end, and on the ends of these there should be teeth, some of which go into others and tightly constrain by force, and sometimes the ends of these are in the shape of a stork's beak, which is wide, and they are of strong constriction.

Capitol .xxxii.	 Chapter 32
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	 Of the care for prominent teeth over others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	 When teeth are prominent and do not follow their natural shape, which can be ugly, especially when this happens to women, and more so to venerable young girls; then you should consider: if the tooth is nothing more than another tooth, and it is impossible to extract or trim it, then remove that one; but if it is attached to another tooth, then cut it with this instrument, which looks like a pig's snout, and is made of Indian steel with a very sharp tip.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	 And make your cut with the instrument you will use to cut it over several days because of the hardness of the tooth, and so that no other tooth is affected.

Capitol .xxxiii.	 Chapter XXXIII.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	 On the restoration of damaged teeth with gold or silver filings.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	 When it happens that the front teeth are dislodged or displaced by a blow or fall, and the patient cannot chew, and you have treated him with astringent medicines, but your treatment has not worked, then in order for them not to decay, fill those strong ones with gold filling and not silver, because silver turns black and decays quickly after a few days, but gold never changes.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida. Capitol .xxxiv.	 Chapter XXXIV
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	 From the beginning of the complaint that affects the tongue, and prohibit speaking.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	 This complaint that appears under the tongue sometimes is either natural and present from birth or accidental and occurs due to a wound that has already healed.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	 And the operation is to open the mouth of the patient, with his head tilted back; raise his tongue, and then cut that nerve-filled complaint according to its length until the tongue is released from its tension.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	 However, if there is any hardness or knotting, and this has happened due to the healing of a wound, then apply oil and cut it lengthwise until you have cut through the complaint and the knot has been dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	 And be careful not to make a slit in the surface of the flesh, and that you cut only the tendon and cause blood flow. ↑ Back to top
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	 Then wash the traces of the incision with vinegar or warm water, and place under the tongue a soft cloth; this is what will hold the patient's tongue under the tongue every night so that it does not stiffen again.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	 "But if there is a flow of blood, place powdered vitriol on the area; but if the blood continues to flow, then cauterize the area with an ancient cautery that is suitable for this purpose.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	 "And treat the patient with other remedies until they are healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	 Chapter 35.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	 "On the removal of a ranula from under the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	 "Sometimes an abscess forms under the tongue, resembling a small bladder, which prevents the tongue from performing its natural function; and soon it swells greatly until it fills the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	 "The operation on it is that you open the mouth of the patient facing the sun and observe the abscess.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	 "And if you see that it is of dark or black color, hard, and the patient does not feel pain in it, then do not touch it because it is cancerous.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	 "And if it inclines towards whiteness, in which there is moisture, then you insert a lance into it, and you cut that with a fine spatula, and you divide it from all sides; and if blood flows during your operation, then you place powdered sulfur, which is vitriol, on top until the bleeding stops.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	 And then return to your task until you have completed it, until he is washed with vinegar and salt; and care for him with the other treatment so that he may be healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	 Chapter XXXVI.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	 On the removal of abscesses from both ears, and on those that grow in the throat, and on other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	 When there is an abscess in the throat, they are glands that resemble cotton, which come out from inside and are called two ears; when you treat them with the water we have mentioned in the division and it does not heal, then consider if the abscess is hard, of dark color, with little sensation, do not touch that one with iron.  (In other words, if the abscess has these characteristics, do not use a cautery on it.)
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	 And if it is red in color and the root is thick, then do not touch that one with iron because of the blood flow; rather let it be until it ripens, and then either you will pierce it, or it will burst on its own.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	 And if it is white in color, reddish, and its root is fine, then that one is the type that needs to be incised.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	 And the operation on him is that you should first consider before your operation if the abscess has been properly drained or if it has decreased somewhat; then make the patient sit facing the sun, and let his head be in your lap, and open his mouth, and a servant holding between his hands should press the tongue of the patient down with an instrument of noble design like this:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	 And it should be made of silver or iron, and it should be thin like a knife blade.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	 So when you press with it on the tongue and see the abscess, catch it with your thumb and index finger, then take a knife and place its edge under it, and pull it outwards as much as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	 Another thing that may be pulled out some of the membranes, then cut it with an instrument like this:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	 and it resembles forceps, but the tips of them are curved in such a way that the opening of one is facing the other, very sharp, which should be made of iron that has been quenched.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	 But if this instrument is not available to you, then cut it with a scalpel that looks like this: and let one side be sharp, while the other side is dull.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	 And since you have incised one wound, incise the other in the same manner of incision. Then let the patient heal from cold water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	 But if there is bleeding, let the patient heal with water boiled with pomegranate rind or myrtle leaves and similar to that, stiptic substances, until the blood flow stops, and then care for him until he is cured.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	 And sometimes this appears as boils or abscesses or both ears, and incise them just as I have said about the incision of two wounds.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	 And I have treated a woman with an abscess that was formed on her throat, which was dark in color and nearly insensible, having already closed her throat, and the woman was breathing with difficulty, and I had forbidden her to eat or drink water, and she would have died if it had lasted for one day or two more.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	 And the abscess had grown so much that it was pushing out through two passages.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	 Therefore, I made an incision and placed one of them in one of the openings, and pulled it out, and a large piece came out with it. And then I incised that which was understood from the other opening, and then I held her mouth open, and pressed her tongue down, and then I placed the instrument in that abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	 And you should cut away a large part of him, and there should be only a little blood coming out from him.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	 Therefore it is certain that the woman's gallbladder has been removed, and she should begin drinking water immediately, and then take food afterwards. I did not stop cutting out parts of that abscess many times over a long period, and another abscess developed in its place, which I cut open until it extended to that point.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	 Therefore I cauterized and burned the gallbladder of him, because of this addition; and then I walked around and did not know what God did with that afterwards near me.
Capitol .xxxvii.	 Chapter .xxxvii.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	 About the cutting of an umbilical hernia when it becomes inflamed.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	 When the catarrh descends to the navel and it is inflamed and long, then it is named a perpendicular; and if it is in the lower part and is large and round, then it is called a buba.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	 But when it is healed with the water we mentioned earlier, and you do not complete your treatment, and likewise if you have already cut out an abscess that was thin, then you should cut off what is attached and round; and if it is of this length, and it is bleeding, dark red or black in color, and it does not heal, then you should attempt to cut it out, because there is danger for the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	 Here's a line-by-line translation of the given sentence:
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	 And it is necessary that you do not ask him about that, but only what is related to the natural course of events without addition, because if you ask him more than that, you will disturb his speech.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	 And for the questioning, use what we have recommended for the questioning of two melons, and take care to do so until it is healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	 But if the patient is afraid of being questioned, it is necessary to use cunning in their cauterization without fear. The manner of the cautery on them is only with sharp water, and you should place the head of the patient on your lap, then press their tongue with the instrument we mentioned earlier. Then take some of the water that has been described in the chapter on cauterization, and perform with it a living cause. Place this neither too thick nor too thin, and fill the concavity of the instrument whose shape is as follows:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	 Let the opening of the concavity in which the medicine is placed be like the concavity of a spoon, and place the instrument with the medicine on the lower lip of the patient, who should then bite down on their tongue so that saliva or mucus from their mouth flows out due to the intrinsic medicine, so that none of it goes down their throat and they are not harmed by it.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	 And then take your hand with the medicine, and squeeze it over the uvula for the space of a half-hour until you see it become blackened and soothed by the bite of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	 And if you wish, take some cotton and wrap it around the tip of the ray (penis), and submerge the cotton in medicine, then insert the penis with the cotton into a glass or tube until the cotton adheres to it, and do this as many times as necessary to achieve the desired effect of cauterizing the uvula. Then leave it alone so that it will dry and fall off in about three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	 And if you need to repeat the application of the medicine, repeat it. Then, after cauterization, clean the surrounding area of the uvula with cotton dipped in wine vinegar, and rinse it with the liquid that is around it from the medicine. After washing with cold water, treat it externally with embrocation, and internally with gargles until it heals.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	 And this type of treatment is more effective and longer-lasting.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	 Sometimes the uvula is healed with something more subtle than cautery and incision, for it can be cured by sublimation in this manner: Take calamus, hyssop, oregano, rue, dried grapes, chamomile, savory, and similar herbs. Mix all these or some of them in a pot, soak them in vinegar, and let them boil; the pot should be well-sealed with clay, and in the middle of the pot there should be an opening, over which you place a concave instrument made of silver or iron in this manner.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	 Here's my best guess at translating the given text into English:
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	 And then repeat the treatment on those parts until they are dry, and be careful not to perform this treatment at the onset of abscess formation, because it would constrict the abscess too much, and you should not do this unless you have obtained the permission of the patient's physician.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	 But if this instrument is not available to you, then take a reed and attach a hen's egg to its end, so that the patient's mouth may be protected, because the shell of the egg prevents the steam from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	 And this treatment is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	 Chapter .xxxviii.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	 Of the removal of splinters and of water that adheres in the throat, and of other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	 Various things adhere in the throat or a thorn from fish or some other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	 Then it is necessary that you extract the water that is apparent from these things, which you see when you press the tongue with an instrument before the sun, so that what is in the throat may be revealed to you.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	 And that which does not appear and is hidden in the throat, it is necessary that you make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, because often the cause attached to the throat is expelled by vomiting; or let the patient swallow a piece of onion or a lettuce root or a mouthful of dry bread; or take a piece of marine sponge, moisten it well with honey, and then have the patient swallow it, for when it reaches the place where there are splinters, they will be expelled.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	 And moreover, take an eel and have it bound in a towel, and place it inside the tablecloth, and afterward extract it; or take a leek and place it under the tablecloth, and afterward remove it.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	 And if you do not remember those reasons which we have mentioned, then use an instrument of lead according to this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	 And let it be thicker than a small reed, and at the end of it there should be a cavity which you insert into his mouth easily.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	 And let him keep his head raised upwards, and be careful that the touch of his throat bone does not cause damage to his body or dislodge a bone or spine, or that which the physician does with his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	 But however, it is better that the patient who inserts this does so skillfully, due to his knowledge of the place and cause attached, and pushes downwards, and pulls his hand with the instrument upwards, all this according to the amount which has been prepared inside until it is removed.
Capitol .xxxix.	 Chapter .39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	 On the Extraction of Bloodsucking Insects Attached to the Throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	 When a bloodsucking insect is treated with the water which we mentioned in the division of treatments without surgery, consider then in the throat of the patient carefully, after you have pushed down his tongue with an instrument which we have recommended to you.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	 If you see a leech, extract it with a small hook or with fine tweezers gently.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	 If you cannot extract it in this way, then take a concave cannula and insert it into the throat of the patient, and place an ignited iron in the concavity of the cannula, and do this several times (until the leech is dead and removed from the throat) and abstain the patient from water for the entire day. ⇔ If you cannot extract [the leech] in this manner, then take a concave cannula and insert it into the patient's throat, and place an ignited iron in the concavity of the cannula, and repeat this process until the leech is dead and removed from the throat. Ensure that the patient abstains from water for the entire day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	 Then take a bowl full of cold water and place the patient's mouth into it, and wash the mouth with it; and do not swallow any of it, but spit out the water after an hour or so using your hand, for as soon as the leech feels the water, it will release.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	 However, if it is not removed with the water we mentioned, then fumigate the patient with camphor or asafoetida using the instrument we have recommended for the fumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	 Based on the pattern of the given text, here's a line-by-line translation for "Fay aquo, so en quar cayra":

Here's the translation of the given sentence:
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	 And if [the cautery] is not done, then you should repeat the fumigation many times, and prevent the patient from drinking, and eating salty and cold foods, and they should not drink water. It is necessary that with this treatment, the [condition] should be forgotten.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	 And this is the shape of the instrument with which bloodletting from the vein is practiced when it is visible; and it resembles forceps as you see them, except that there are some curves in it.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	 which is placed on the vein, and its end resembles the beak of a stork, which is curved, in which a file is sharpened, so that when you compress any cause, it does not slip.
Capitol .xl.	 Chapter .40
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	 In which is the summary of the discussion on abscesses and their incision.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	 Abscesses are many kinds, in many ways, as is remembered about them, each of which is described in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	 And they are different in their perforation and incision by two ways, one of which is according to the type of abscess itself; and because of what we understand from the humors.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	 And the second manner is specific to the places where the affliction occurs in the body, for the abscess that appears on the head is different from the abscess that appears on the buttocks; and the abscess that appears in a fleshy area is different from the abscess that appears in a joint; and each of these has its own treatment based on their location.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	 And moreover, there are certain abscesses that should not be pierced until the pus within them has matured or reached its completion.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	 Other abscesses should be lanced when they are new and not yet matured according to their natural course, such as those that appear near the joints. For an abscess appearing near a joint prolongs its existence until it can spread to the surrounding area, and quickly the ligaments or nerves of that joint become corrupted, leading to contraction of that limb. Or if the abscess is near a main member, delaying the piercing until the pus has matured can cause damage to the main member; or if it is near the buttocks, then pierce it even when not yet matured, but do not pierce it while still immature and improperly digested, except for those near the buttocks, so that the pus cannot spread further inside the buttocks and create a fistula, or cause an incurable condition.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	 "But you should know the time for the incision of the abscess, and this is when it has matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	 "And know that it is matured when there is relief from pain and fever, as well as a decrease in swelling and pulse rate, and the head of the abscess becomes more pointed, along with other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	 "And you should know that the incision should be made in the lowest part of the abscess, and from this comes the cure of the prominence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	 "And the incision should always be along the length of the skin or body, if the abscesses are in the places of hands or feet, and in the areas of wrists, tendons, nerves, arteries; and finally, in all parts except those in which there is reflection; because in those that are reflected, use incision according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	 "But when the abscess is in a fleshy part, it is better to leave the incision until its digestion has been confirmed according to our previous instructions; because if you incise before that, the body of the pus and much filth will be prolonged, and it will easily open the lips of it and increase its depth.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	 This text appears to be discussing the treatment of certain conditions involving swellings or abscesses (apostemas). Here's a line-by-line translation:

"And it is necessary to administer a small puncture, and for large abscesses, a large and wide incision or multiple shallow cuts according to the size of the abscess.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	 "And there are other types of abscesses where the blade should be concave and incised, when done so that it is as wide as a slice of bread, this is usually done in cases of double boils and buboes.

Be cautious when approaching this chapter, and ensure that your puncture in the area you are treating is clean. Consider whether the wound from the abscess is small or a flat cut. If it is small, you should administer ointments of lily or cota antica. If the abscess is large and the openings are many, then place cotton wool in each opening until they all meet together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	 And if in the abscess there is a part that has been cut off or hollowed out, then you should fill it with old cotton or cloth made into strips, as when you have crushed bread or radishes, without moisture; and strengthen it for three days; and then proceed to cauterize and treat it with water suitable for ointments until it is healed.

De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	 On the cutting of abscesses that occur in the back of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	 In the back of the head, small abscesses form, and these are like certain types of knots that contain thin skins on their surface; and the type of these is many.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	 And their blisters are formed, and from those that contain moisture similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	 And of these are the ones that contain moisture similar to dust, and resemble them; and of these are those that are stony, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	 And in the cutting of all [of these], and in their removal there is no fear, because the extraction of them does not cause any contrary effect.

E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa. E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula. E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada. E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	 And sometimes there are certain abscesses in the head of some people with whom there is absolutely no moisture; this is because I once cut open an abscess on the head of an old woman and found it to be like a hard, rough, white stone that could not be crushed, and if anyone were struck by it, they would suffer.

De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	 Of the incision of scrofula which occurs in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	 Often these abscesses appear in the neck and in the armpits and groin area, and sometimes they occur in other parts of the body.

Quan le sanc es abscindit.	 When the blood has been cut.

E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	 And it most commonly occurs in the places of the ankles or the sole, or in any place where the joints are painful.

And it is a severe abscess, and its color resembles that of the rest of the body, and it is most commonly found in those who are weakened and when it becomes tight with intensity, the patient feels a similar numbness.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	 And it is not an abscess that grows on the front of the body, and for this reason it leaves the spine, and it hurts in all parts and does not go to the parts before or behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	 Therefore, those that are on the joints should not be bound with iron, because very soon it will cause constriction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	 "But those that are in the head or in the forehead use a spatula.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	 "But if the abscess is small, then cut it with scissors and remove it by its roots.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	 "And if it is large, then suspend it with hooks, and excise it, and immediately remove it; and close the wound with stitches, and care for it until it is healed.

De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	 On the treatment of a swelling of the navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu. De curacio de cranc.	 On the treatment of cancer.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu. Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo. E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments. Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	 Therefore, if it is the type with angles and edges, insert into the cleft.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	 And if it cannot be removed that way, then you must contrive something over it, or press something on it with a suitable tool, the tip of which should be like a file with which you can grind on the stone without it breaking; or insert a fine instrument with a curved tip underneath it.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	 But if you cannot do so on that one, then widen the opening slightly. And if you see a flow of blood, cut it strongly with dissolved vitriol.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	 But if the stone is more than one, then at first you should insert your hand into the mouth of the bladder and cut it out; then you should make a small incision nearby; and similarly act if there are more than two stones.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	 And if the stone is very large, it is unwise to cut it with a large incision, because two things may happen to the patient: either death or continuous dripping of urine, because the area may not be completely healed.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	 But arrange to expel it while it is still fresh, or contrive to break it with forceps so that you can extract the pieces.

E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	 And then make the patient lie on their side, and do not remove the bandage until the third day.

But if in the wound an abscess forms that is tense and corrosive, and it appears as if the blood in the bladder is congealed, which prevents urination (and this is known by the presence of blood in the urine), then insert your finger into the wound and extract that blood, because if it remains, it will cause the bladder to become corrupt and the patient to putrefy.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	 Then wash the wound with vinegar, water and salt, and with opposition to all kinds of spices, using what is appropriate for their healing until it is healed.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	 And during all the hours of treatment, you should lift both the cushions and adjust the medicines placed on the wound.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	 And if the stone is small and in the urethra, and it is stuck there, and urination is blocked, then treat it with water that I recommended earlier before it becomes too dry, because excessive drying from this treatment has been accused of causing dryness; and I have experimented with this, and what you should do is take a drill made of soft iron, which looks like this:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	 "From an acute, triangular projection, placed in a stick.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	 "Then take thread and tie it to the rod, placing a weight beneath so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	 "Then insert the iron into the rod, piercing until the piercer reaches that stone.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	 "And turn the piercer with your hand in that stone little by little, and you will pierce its opening until you make it penetrate on the other side; because the urine is immediately released.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	 "Then press your hand over the hole that has been made on the side of the stone outside the rod, because it is blocked and plugged with urine, and the patient is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	 "But if this treatment is not suitable for you due to some reason that prevents it, then tie a thread under the stone and another thread on top of the stone.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	 "Then place between the two ties on the rod over the stone.
E aprop extratz aquela.	 "Then remove that.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	 "Then untie the bandage and clean the congealed blood, which is in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua. De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	 On the Extraction of Stones from Women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	 Stones in women are rarely formed.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	 However, if stones occur in any of them, then its cure is difficult and is forbidden by many methods.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	 One reason is that the woman must be very strong (or determined).
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	 And the second reason is that you cannot find a woman who is learned enough to reveal herself to the doctor when she is chaste or has no husband.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	 The third reason is that you cannot find a woman who is very skilled in this art, especially for operations by hand.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	 And the fourth reason is that the place of incision for stones in women is far from the place of the stone, which requires a preliminary incision, and this involves fear (or risk). ️
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	 However, if necessity forces you to do so, then it is necessary for you to take a very learned midwife, and few are found. ️

De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	 On incising a fleshy hernia and its treatment.

De castracio.	 Of Castration
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	 Know that castration in our law is forbidden, but I have heard of it being done and will mention it here in this book; and the reason for mentioning it is twofold: one is so that it may be known to doctors when they are asked about it, that they know the treatment for those to whom it happens; and the other reason is that sometimes we need castration of other animals for our benefit from them, such as with bulls, goats, pigs, and similar animals.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	 And therefore I say that castration is done in two ways: either by traction or by incision and section.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	 But in that which is done by traction, the way of the operation is to make the animal sit in hot water until its testicles are softened and lengthened and hang down.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	 And then take those with your hand inside so that they are resolved and do not appear after touching them.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	 But in the case of castration done by cutting and slicing, it is necessary that you hold the animal and press its testicles with your left hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	 Then tie the suspensory ligaments, and make an incision over each testicle with a single cut until two testicles are processed.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	 And then cut those that you will have skinned.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	 And do not leave anything on those of the scrotum for any reason, except for a thin layer that is over the vessels.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	 And this method of castration is better when done by crushing, because crushing firmly removes any cause of the testicles so that the animal no longer desires mating.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	 Then care for the wound until it heals.

De curacio de las plaguas.	 On the treatment of wounds.

De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	 About the origin of veins, they are called varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	 Veins are varicose veins, and they are large, twisted vessels filled with melancholic excesses that appear in the limbs of the body, most commonly in the legs, especially among travelers, workers, and carriers.

Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	 However, their cure with iron is done in two ways: one way is that it be incised and the black blood be drawn out; the other way is that the vein be raised and all of it be extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	 The incision is done in this way: first, wrap the leg of the patient with hot water until the thick blood, which is foul from the leg, is resolved. Then strengthen the leg of the patient to the upper part of the thigh down to the lower part of the knee with a bandage, and then make an incision in one place, or two, or three with a wide cut. And then draw out the black blood from the lower part of the leg upwards with your left hand, up and down, until you have extracted as much blood as you wish and as many times as is necessary to restore the patient's health.

Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	 Shape of the instrument with which the intestine is cut:
Forma de unci orp:	 Shape of the hook:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	 It is not as sharp as the hooks nor does it have a pointed tip so that it does not injure the vein; and it has great flexibility, for if it were thin, it would cut the vein due to its thinness; there is some unnecessary thickness in it as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	 Of the extraction of the calf vein.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	 This vein is generated in the thighs in hot lands, such as Al-Andalus in Arabic land and in the hot and dry lands of India with little humidity, where there is neither grass nor trees.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	 And sometimes it is generated in other parts of the body besides the thighs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	 And its generation is from putrefaction, which comes after the bowel movement, just like poisonous snakes and worms and scorpions and worms that generate between the bowels and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	 And the sign of its onset is this: in the thigh, there is a vein that becomes severely inflamed; and then the place swells up; and then the vein begins to come out of that swelling, like a plant root.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	 And when its tip appears, then you should wrap around it a lead weight that weighs between one and two pounds. Tie it on and let the lead hang from the thigh.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	 And every time something comes out of it for any reason to the outside parts, wrap that in lead and tie it off.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	 And if it is prolonged, then you should cut off a piece of it and wrap the rest; and do not cut that one straight until it has come out, because if you cut it straight it will contract and enter into the flesh and cause an abscess and rotting in the place and a bad ulcer.

De extraccio de sagetas.	 About the removal of arrows
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas. Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	 The shape of the ventouse administered with fire: it should have an opening the size of two fingers, as we have made it; and the amount of material should be half a palm's length; and it should be on the back of the patient, in the area where the ribs are, halfway up the back, and the hole should be small enough that only the tip of a needle can fit inside.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	 It should be made of red or yellow copper, with thick rims, smooth and polished so that it does not hurt the member on which it is placed.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	 And in the middle of it should be a transverse iron or steel rod, on which a candle with fire is placed.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	 And this ventouse should be much larger than the one we mentioned earlier; and the smaller ones should be used according to the illness and condition of the patient.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	 "And the cupping methods for children and the weak are different from those for young people and robust individuals.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	 "And the quality of placing this cupping glass with fire on the limb is that you extend the cloth with decent firewood in front of a few wax candles, and place it in the middle of the cross-sectional beam of the cupping glass, so that the fire is lit around the lower part to prevent the patient's body from being burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	 "And then it is placed on the patient's limb, and the finger is on the hole we mentioned, until when we have the cupping glasses and do not need to remove the finger, steam will rise over that hole, at which point the cupping glass will immediately be removed.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	 "And then the cloth is ignited according to its manner, and it is repeated if needed.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	 "However, in the case of cupping for pleurisy, it is done with water, and there is no cross-sectional beam or hole, and it is not administered unless it is filled with water, and it is placed on the limb only.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	 "And this is its shape: And this cupping glass, the larger it is, the better, because it can receive a greater quantity of water.

E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu. Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	 This chapter is very necessary in the art of medicine; it deals with the restoration of bone fractures and dislocations.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	 Oh, son, know that many foolish doctors and laypeople boast about this chapter, those who at any time do not respect the books of the Ancients nor read a letter from them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels. E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	 And now I will direct my efforts towards experiments and studies for the remainder of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.
