Capitol primier.	 Chapter one.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	 Summary and collections concerning the essence of bone fractures, from which necessary preface is required before we begin to recall the members that are broken and diverse in each one.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	 Therefore, in the preface of this chapter, we will state the main points of the argument; and we will discuss the chapters whose understanding at the beginning is necessary for the artists to be firmly established on the truth of those [chapters]; so that it may be you and others who are prompt in learning or knowing this noble art from you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	 And so I say that when some fracture, dislocation, twist, or fall occurs, then you should begin with phlebotomy or bloodletting, or both together, if no cause prohibits it, such as weakness of strength, or it is a child to whom it happens, or an old person in decrepitude, or it is the time of very hot weather, or of very cold [weather].
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	 This text seems to be discussing dietary restrictions or recommendations for a patient with joint pain caused by cold humors. Let's break it down:
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	 And then return the patient to his original state or condition with which he is accustomed to.

And so when the broken bone begins to be restored, it is necessary that the patient be fed with nutritious foods of thick and heavy consistency, such as dishes made from boiled wheat with water, rice, heads, hooves, stomachs, livers, fresh lungs, fatty meat similar to these, and with this regimen, the bone fracture heals more easily and better.

And know that broken bones in those who are in their first youth and in the elderly cannot be continued and healed according to their nature due to the dryness of their members.

And they are healed and continued according to their nature always because of the dryness of those members, and they are continued and healed in those who are at the end of their youth, such as the bones of young children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	 But nevertheless nature adjusts and attaches over the broken bone from every side similar to glue in which there is a thick substance that adheres and strengthens it until it is completely conglutinated and united together, until it reaches the end of strength and firmness, just like fire at the beginning, until any cause prevents it from its work.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	 And for this reason, it is necessary to pause the food of the patient, food that is heavy and viscous and thick, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	 Different types of fractures according to different members (limbs).
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	 And know that the types of fractures are diverse according to the diversity of the members, for a fracture in the bone of the thigh is different from a fracture in the bone of the head; and a fracture in the bone of the foot is different from a fracture in the bone of the hand; and similarly, all the other members are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	 And I come with the memory of every type of fracture, each one explained in its own separate chapter.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	 About the diversity of fractures within themselves.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	 And the types of bone fractures are also diverse within themselves; for some fractures are curved, others straight; and sometimes fractures occur according to the length of the bone: these are the fractures of the splinters and chips that protrude and do not protrude, just as it is done in a feather when it is prepared to be written, and there are fractures with bruising and tearing in the head, and there are small cracks.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	 Here is a translation of the given sentence into English:
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	 "Mota senhal de fractura del os" translates to "A clear sign of bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	 "And by this it is known to be a bone fracture: there is a twist in it, and a swelling or prominence felt upon touch, and a cracking sound when you press on it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	 "And therefore, when there is no apparent twisting or cracking sound upon your touch, and the patient does not feel great pain when you shake the bone, then it is not a fracture here.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	 "However, it is possible that there is a twist or small fissure, therefore do not move the bone with your hand and apply pressure all over; then place on it of the medicines which are remembered at this moment which suit the place; and then bind it tightly for a precise compression.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut. Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma. E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	 "And be careful according to your strength that no pain or injury occurs to the patient due to your operation; and strive according to your ability to apply one bone to its companion in the best way.

"And avoid excessive stretching and compression, as many foolish doctors do who, with their improper operations, cause a painful abscess to form due to their operation, or cause contraction in the limb, as we have seen this occur due to the operation of their unskilled hands.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	 And immediately after that, you should proceed with a proper balance and careful operation of tightening the affected member, ensuring rest and tranquility; advise the patient about this and ensure that they do not disturb it during their waking hours or sleep, observe its rotation and movement, and monitor all their movements with all their strength; and wait to see if the position of the member is such that it is guaranteed to be pain-free, because when one feels pain or injury in the position of the member, then it is necessary to change it to another position where there is no pain; and ensure that this position is straight and even, so that the member does not become twisted when restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	 And the quality of tightening the calm member is what I recommend; for you to know that broken members are diverse in their smallness and largeness and in their form.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	 And for those that are small, such as the arm and finger and toe, similar to these, then the wrapping should be of fine, soft cloth.

But for those that are large, such as the thigh or leg, it is necessary that there be a strong and hard wrapping, because a strong wrapping connects the large member with equal strength from all sides, so that in it no stain enters.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	 And now begin, start your evacuation of excrement, place appropriate bandages on that for the break, over the area of that fracture with three or four wrappings depending on the member's size; and strengthen your hand slightly with the bandage.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	 And now come to that part which is superior to the place of the fracture, and strengthen more so that you do not break your bandage with which you have strengthened the place of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	 And now lengthen yourself with a wrapping of the place of the fracture a little, and soften the bandage little by little, until you take from the place a great length.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	 And now take another bandage and wrap it again over the broken place with wrapping, and now come to the wrappings below the fracture; and let your operation be in the tightness of the wrapping and in softening it according to what we have said in the first wrapping above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	 And now place between the wrappings of linen or cloth with which the crookedness of the fracture is equalized, if there is any crookedness in it; and if not, do not place anything there for any reason.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas. E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	 And let the stilts of the main part be made of reeds, well-formed and woven together; or they may be made of pine wood; or from palm branches. And let each stilt be as wide as this form and this figure:

E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels. E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	 And be careful according to your skill that the wound in your care is clean; and there should be no ignorance of ointment or anything else on it; nor allow virulence to increase within him; for when it is placed on the thin layer of skin, it corrupts and poisons that, and causes a malignant illness to come upon the patient.

And it occurs in the cavity of the skull, especially when the bone is exposed and the care is neglected, and there is darkness on its surface; therefore consider if these accidents happen to the patient, as we have said, know that it is fatal without any doubt.

Capitol .iiii.	 Chapter IV.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	 On the restoration of the jaw when it is broken.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	 When the jaw has been broken and the break is not due to injury, look then if the break is only on the outside and not broken in two and bent at the inside parts, then its diagnosis is easy.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	 And therefore, if the break is on the right side, you should insert your left index finger into the patient's mouth; and similarly, if the break is in the left jaw, then insert the right index finger; and with that push the swelling of the fracture inside towards the outside parts with your other hand from the outside of the bone; with that you can straighten it.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu. And if there is a disruption of the teeth due to shock, then strengthen those which you hope will remain with gold or silver wire or silk thread; and then place wax over the broken jaw, and then place a double layer of cloth over it, and place over that a large, well-made bandage or a sole of leather equal to the length of the jaw; and then bind it above according to how you are accustomed to binding it and as is suitable for the application, until it is not destroyed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	 And command the patient to rest and remain calm, and give him sparse meals.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	 And if you think the shape has already been altered in any way, then wait and remove it on the third day; and then correct that which is altered from him and plaster it with powder of mastic, egg white, or cumin flour, after you have removed the wax from him, and place wool over the plaster.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	 And when the plaster is thus attached and adjusted to him, and the bone’s position has not been altered, leave it in place until he is healed and strengthened, for many times this fracture becomes strong within three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	 And if it so happens that an abscess forms, then administer what has been said many times before in his sedation until he is healed and the abscess is removed.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	 And if the fracture is with a wound, then consider whether it is a piece of bone separated or splinters; then you should be careful to remove those splinters with what is appropriate for removing them from the instruments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	 And if the opening of the wound is narrow, then you should widen it with a fleam according to your need.

Capitol .v.	 Chapter 5
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	 Of the restoration of the collarbone when it is broken.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	 Often, the collarbone is broken from a fall in front, and this fracture occurs in one of three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	 Because it is broken, separated, or split into two parts without splinters; and it is easy to restore it; or it happens that there are splinters in it, and its restoration is difficult; or it happens that the break is with a wound.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	 And the operation for this, when the fracture is without a wound, is that you have two assistants present, so that one supports and follows the broken collarbone, and the other extends the neck toward the injured area.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	 And then you should bring the fracture together with your fingers until it is properly aligned, without any bumps or hollows.

And if you need more extension, then place a pillow or woolen cloth under the patient's head, with its size according to your necessity; stretch and raise the neck support (furcula) and shorten the pillow with your hand until it fits the fracture as needed.

E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz. E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	 And it is similar to the cuirass which this is the cavity; and let its length be according to what you need from it, whether it is for a large or small bone.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	 But let its length be suitable for the operation; that it has two ends like this, and one end is wide while the other is narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	 And if the wound you have cut when extracting the arrow from the bone is wide, and you are sure that there will be no abscess, then you sew together the two lips of the wound with stitches.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	 And if the wound is small or you fear an abscess, then fill the wound with cloths and bandages according to the size of the cut of the wound.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	 And if an abscess forms, then insert a cloth soaked in vinegar and rose oil and wine into it, and place it on top.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	 But the contraction of the bone, when there is no wound and no cut, is that you place a plaster made from ground flour and egg white on it, and then place a stopper on top. And then place a sphere under the tip of it, if you need to, and then take a bandage, which is what the Saracens use, and let it be very long, and its length should be about one palm or thereabouts; and then place double-layered cloths over the stopper and the plaster; and then take a thin wooden board whose length is three fingers and of similar length; and then wrap that in cloth, and then wrap that cloth with the board on the spot over the fracture site; and then place bandages as it is needed, and turn it around the patient's neck and under the tip of him and under the tip of the patient, and bring it back all around, and whenever the contraction of the fracture decreases, that is what you should not hide from yourself.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	 And also, ensure that the splint is not too tight over the broken bones; therefore, it is necessary for you to check the patient each day, and when the bandage becomes softened or you see the splint starting to shift, then you should correct this and strengthen the bandage.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	 And then place the patient's head on their neck, and under their chin place a small cushion during the night, so that with this the ligaments of the throat are lifted from the back, and thus the fracture of the furcula is also elevated due to the elevation of the muscle; or tie the patient's arm to their neck.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	 And do not untie the bandage unless you see pus or an abscess in the place within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	 And then renew the plaster if you have seen swelling on it, and adjust in the constriction and restore that, and leave until the fracture of the furcula is restored and coagulated.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	 And it is strengthened and made comfortable according to the moon in twenty-eight days, and sometimes in some men it is done in a month's time of that.

Capitol .vii.	 Chapter VII.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	 On the restoration of a broken foot.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	 The foot sometimes breaks in the middle of it, and this delays healing; but the ends of it move easily and are separated and shattered.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	 And of the accidents that occur when its middle part is broken, it causes a decline in internal functions and great pain, difficulty in breathing, coughing, strong fever, and vomiting blood; and it is evident in the cavity of the broken bone and cannot be hidden from sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	 And the restoration of it is that the patient be laid on their back, and a cushion be placed between their shoulders; then press the muscles together, and adjust the ribs with the hands of two assistants, and be skilled in the operation and in the equalization according to all possible manners and what is convenient for this, until the shape of the bone returns as it should.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	 Then place on the patient plaster and cloth, and on top of that a thin board made of willow or hazel or something similar in lightness; after wrapping it in linen, be careful to bind it over the broken bone so that it is not moved; and go with the bandage according to the roundness of the back several times, and strengthen that with decent tightness; and always consider the bandage, and when it becomes softened, strengthen it again.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat. Capitol .viii.	 Chapter VIII.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	 On the restoration of the ribs when they are broken.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	 Know that a fracture of the ribs does not occur except in large places such as the back; and at the ends of their division towards the front, this condition does not happen unless it is due to the fact that they are cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	 And the knowledge of it is not hidden from feeling; you should examine it with your hands.
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	 And the restoration should be done in such a way that you enclose the fracture with your hands according to the most possible manner, until it is enclosed as needed. E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	 And the ancients have dealt with it in a very ingenious way.

Capitol .ix.	 Chapter .ix.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	 On the restoration of a broken vertebra of the spine and the neck.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	 Sometimes a fracture occurs in the bones of the neck, and later it extends to their cartilage, and similarly to the vertebrae of the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	 And when this happens to someone and you want to know if they will be healed or not, then consider: for if you see their hands are already softened and numb and dead, and they cannot move those nor extend them nor strengthen them, and when you press those with your fingers or prick them with a needle and feel no pain there, then you should know that it is not healed, and in this case the patient will certainly die.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	 And if they move those and feel constriction with your fingers or a needle prick, then you should know that the bone of the neck is safe and that the patient will recover with treatment.
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	 And if you see the same in the vertebrae of the neck and want to know if it will be healed or not, then consider the patient's feet.

Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	 If no cause of these [ailments] occurs, the cause is better and lighter.

Capitol .xi.	 Chapter XI
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	 On the healing of a broken toe
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	 The toe is that which is between the heel and the ball of the foot.
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	 And if it is broken, then the healing of it is done in one of two ways. One way is for you to take a thin piece of wood of medium thickness according to this form:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	 And there should be ligaments tied at both ends, and then it should be suspended from an elevated place.
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	 And follow the patient onto a seat; and then throw their broken arm over the pole until it reaches its middle, where the curve of the pole is attached.
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	 And then suspend the patient from that for some serious reason, or let the servant extend him on the sides; and then let the doctor place the fracture with his hands together, until the fracture returns to its proper place.
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	 Another way is for the patient to be placed on his back and the hand of his neck tied up; then command two servants, one of whom holds what is above the fracture with his hands, and the other holds the feet below him; and each of them extends to their side.
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	 And if you want the extension to be stronger, then you strengthen on the fracture with a bandage and on that with another bandage, and each of the two servants extends to their two sides.
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	 And therefore, if the fracture is near the end of the muscle, it is necessary that half of the bandage be placed on the little finger and the other below the fracture by the elbow.

Capitol .xii.	 Chapter XII.
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	 On the restoration of a fractured arm.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	 The arm is composed of two bones called the two ulnae; one of them is small and is called the little finger, and the other is large and is placed below the small bone on the lower side.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	 And it often happens that only the larger ulna is broken, or the smaller one, and sometimes both are broken together.
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	 And when the smaller ulna is broken above, then its restoration is easier, and its healing is faster.
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	 And when it is broken below, the fracture of it is bad, and its healing is difficult.
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	 And worse than that is when two bones are broken together.
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	 Therefore, if the bone that is broken is the smaller ulna above, it is fitting for the doctor to make a small extension with ease until it is equalized.
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	 But if the larger ulna is broken, then he should make a more vigorous extension.
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	 And if both needles are held together at the same time, then you should press harder on the needle holder.
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	 And you should position the patient's hand in such a way that their arm and hand are extended on a cushion, with the wrist bent upwards, as with all the other positions mentioned before, and the auricular part should be lower than the others, and the patient should be sitting on a low chair.
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	 And there should be a cushion in front of him at the appropriate height for him, so that the patient does not have to work or exert themselves.
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	 And then one of the assistants should extend the arm from the wrist down with their own hand or with a bandage, and another assistant should do the same above.
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	 And then the doctor should envelop the bone until it is reduced in the best possible shape.
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	 And if there are splinters in the bone, then you should carefully remove all of them from their place with your skill.
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	 And if a splinter appears that punctures the tendon and you do not hope for its reduction, then you should cut it off and remove it according to the manner we mentioned above.
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	 If the fracture is accompanied by a wound, I have already addressed that in a separate chapter; therefore, take care of it accordingly.
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.	 And if an abscess occurs at the beginning of your treatment, then take a cloth and make it into a bandage with oil and white wax, ensuring it is between thick and thin, and place a strong cloth over it with a thin tightness until the abscess subsides; then remove the bandage and apply a prepared poultice made from powdered chalk and egg whites, and afterward apply hot stones. And let the stone that is placed on that fracture be the hottest and strongest.
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	 And know that the number of stones for the arm is as follows in the major treatments: whether the fracture is in one joint or in two joints together.
E aprop pausa la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura pus fort e pus vehement, e quan mays sira la extrictura a las partidas desus de la fractura o a las partidas pus bassas de lu, pausa la strictura un pauc pus molh segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu en le comensament del capitol.	 Then place your bandage over the site of the fracture as strongly and as intensely as possible. And when the bandage extends to the parts above the fracture or to the parts below it, moisten the bandage a little more according to what is mentioned at the beginning of the chapter.
E les draps que so envolopatz sobre la fractura sian draps mols humitz, e no sian durs ni aspres, e·l fiel am le qual es strenhut sia de li propriament migier entre subtil e gros, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	 And the cloths that are wrapped around the fracture should be soft and moist, not hard or rough, and the thread with which they are tightened should be made of linen, being precisely between thin and thick, as we have recommended.
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	 And consider the member and the ligament for about ten days.
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	 And if any cause occurs that requires correction, such as pressure on the affected member, then it is necessary to immerse the member in hot water until the pressure ceases.
E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	 And let the member not be constricted until it rests, and then return the constriction.
E si la extrictura ja es mollificada e l’os ja es remaugut e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras rectifiqua tot aquo am la tua vertut.	 And if the constriction has already been softened and the bone has moved back into place, then correct everything with your skill.
E considera mays si le nutriment es prohibit pervenir al membre per superfluitat de strictura, quar lahoras cove que mollifiques aquel un petit e laysses aquel per alcus dias entro que corra ad aquel le nutriment, e aprop strenh aquel.	 And consider also if the nourishment is prevented from reaching the member due to an excess of constriction, for then it is necessary to soften that a little and let it be for some days until the nourishment reaches that place, and then strengthen it.
Mays si al malaute no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no cove que sia desliat entro aprop xx dias o enviro de aquels.	 But if the patient does not experience any of those causes that we have mentioned, then it is not necessary to release him until about twenty days or around that time.
E aprop sia suspenduda la ma del malaute per la sua vertut de movement agitatius, e fay aquel dormir sobre le sieu dos.	 And then the patient's hand should be suspended by his own skill of agitating movements, and make him sleep on his back.
E sapias que aquesta fractura es restaurada en xxx dias o en xxxii dias, o fort leu es restaurada en xxviii dias, e tot aquo es segon la disposicio de las compleccios e las disposicios de la vertut.	 And know that this fracture is healed in thirty days or forty-two days, or it is quickly healed in twenty-eight days, and all of this depends on the condition of the patient's constitution and the skill of the physician.
Capitol .xiii.	 "Chapter XIII.
De restauracio de fractura de la pinche de la ma e dels ditz.	 "On the restoration of a finger fracture and related conditions.
Sapias que a la pinche de la ma e als nuzes dels ditz tart endeve fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio motas veguadas.	 "Know that in the fingers of the hand and the toes of the feet, it is customary for a break to occur, and it does not happen except when they are struck with some force.
E quan accideys a la ma fractura o atrissio, lahoras cove que·l malaute segua cayrat e denant lu lies cezent segon equalitat, e aprop pausa la ma de lu sobre aquela extenduda.	 "And when a break or injury occurs in the hand, it is necessary for the patient to be seated and placed facing him, centering his gaze on what he sees equally, and then place his injured hand on an extended surface.
E aprop le ministre extenda les osses trencatz e·l metge engualhe aquels entro que sian congongitz am bona congoncio.	 "Then the attendant should extend the broken bones, and the physician should bandage them together until they are well joined with a good bond.
E lahoras cove que pause emplastre e estopa, si no accideys apostema caut; e aprop pausa stela desus segon la quantitat del loc, e tu ja has envolopada aquela en drap de li.	 "And at this point it is necessary to place a plaster and cloth on it, so that a post-operative abscess does not occur; then place steel on top according to the size of the area, and you have already wrapped it in linen.
Mays si la trincadura es en las partidas dedintz deves le ventre de la palma, e lahoras fay semblant de spera de drap, e comanda al malaute que strenha aquela am la sua palma trincada; aprop sia strenguda am drap lonc.	 "However, if the fracture is in the part closest to the palm, and it goes through the belly of the palm, then make something similar to a sphere of cloth, and command the patient to hold it with his broken palm; it should be bound tightly with long cloth.
E sia la stelha de cuer am drap en le qual sia levitat, per so que le cuer sia aplicat a la palma; e strenh aquela segon que cove.	 "And let the steel be covered in leather wrapped in cloth, so that the leather is applied to the palm; and bind it as necessary.
Mays si la fractura es a las partidas defora, lahoras cove que pauses desus stela e autre estela de la partida dejos en la palma, per so que la ma sia uberta e dreyta; e aprop pausa la strictura, ayssi cum es revolvuda la ma a la rateta entre les ditz am liamentz.	 If the fracture is in the outer part of the hand, then you should place a steel plate on top and another steel plate underneath in the palm, so that the hand is open and straight; and then apply the bandage, just as the hand is turned at the wrist between these ligaments.
E si accideys fractura a alcu dels nozes dels ditz, lahoras si es le dit pous, sia engualat segon que cove e aprop sia strenhut am la palma e si·t voles, pausa a lu astela petita dreyta per so que sia elevada la fractura e no sia mauguda.	 And if there is a fracture in any of the bones mentioned above, then if it is a toe, wrap it as needed and strengthen it with the palm; and if you wish, place a small straight plate on it, so that the fracture is raised and not aggravated.
Mays si la fractura es en les autres ditz, ayssi cum en aquel del mieg loc, o en le indic, o en le auricular, o en le anular, lahoras sia engualhat e liat am le dit sa le qual siec aquel; o sian totz liatz segon continuacio, e es milhor; o pausa sobre aquel stela petita, ayssi cum havem dit en le pous.	 However, if the fracture is in the other fingers, such as the middle finger, or the index finger, or the ring finger, or the little finger, then it should be wrapped and bandaged with the same finger; or all of them can be bandaged together continuously, which is better; or place a small plate on top, as we have said for the toe.
E considera, en la tua restauracio, e aprop aquela, la disposicio de apostema caut e oppose — am la tieua operacio — am aquo que cove quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, segon que es iterada la narracio de lu.	 And consider, in your treatment and then this one, the disposition of a cautious abscess — with your operation — with what is needed when any of these causes occur, as stated in his account.
Capitol .xiv.	 Chapter XIV.
De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	 "On the healing of a broken bone in the hip.
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	 "The bones of the hips are often broken and perceived by touch, according to their conversion into the anterior partition and the superior part.
E la restauracio de lu se fa enayssi que·l liament es strenhut sobre la fractura e autre liament dejos la fractura, e le malaute sia prostrat sobre le sieu ventre e sobre la cara.	 "And its healing is done by tightening a bandage over the break and another bandage under the break, while the patient lies face down on their stomach.
E aprop le ministre extenda tot le liament a la sua partida segon la qualitat, quan la fractura es en le mieg loc del os.	 "And then the attendant extends all of the bandage to its partition according to quality, when the break is in the middle of the bone.
Mays si es propdana a la razitz de la cueyssa, lahoras sia le liament propda al denolh a la partida del pentenilh, per so que la extencio caja en sus, e le autre liament dejos la fractura.	 "But if it is at the hip joint, then let the bandage be close to the groin towards the thigh, so that its extension may enter there, and another bandage under the break.
E semblantment si la trencadura es propdana al denolh, lahoras sia fayt le liament propda al denol, e sia la extencio a las partidas dejos.	 "And similarly, if the break is at the groin, then let the bandage be made close to the groin, and its extension towards the back parts.
E aprop le metge enguale le os am amduas las sieuas mas entro que reduzesca aquel segon la semblansa natural e l’os es conjungit per bona conjunccio; lahoras cove que pauses emplastre e strictura, si no accideys al membre apostema.	 "And then the physician aligns the bone with both of his hands until it is reduced according to its natural shape and the bone is united by a good union; then it is necessary to place a plaster and stricture, lest an abscess occur in the limb.
Mays si accideys en lu apostema, lahoras tu layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que l’apostema caut sia cedat, e aprop retorna a la tua curacio.	 "But if it occurs in the patient an abscess, then you leave that for some days until the abscess has ripened and come to a head, and then you return to your treatment.
La strictura de lu sia ayssi fayta: cove que envolopes sobre la fractura una benda dura, e dobla aquela dos o tres veguadas, e remaugua de lu superfluitat; e aprop envolopa la camba entro que pervengua al talo e a la razitz de la cueyssa.	 "The stricture of the patient should be done as follows: you must wrap around the fracture a hard bandage, and fold it two or three times, removing excess; then wrap the thigh until it reaches the ankle and the root of the groin.
E intromet lonc fiel entre la cueyssa e la camba prop del denol a las partidas dejos, e venguan las extremitatz del fiel de la partida pus sobirana de las doas partz, e aprop revolveys sobre la camba e la cueyssa aquo que superflueys de la benda.	 "And insert a long needle between the thigh and the leg near the bone in the divided parts, and let the ends of the needle emerge from the higher part of the two parts, then revolve on the thigh and leg what is left over from the bandage.
E aprop pausa sobre la cueyssa en le loc de aquela fractura astelhas, e pausa de aquelas una stela sobre le os de la camba.	 "And then place on the thigh in the spot of that fracture thistles, and place one of those thistles on the bone of the leg.
E aprop uempli las vacuitatz entre la camba e la cuoyssa am draps mols, per so que sia coagulada la extrictura.	 "And then fill the empty spaces between the thigh and the leg with soft cloths, so that the stricture is tightened.
E aprop comensa am strictura fort del mieg sobre le loc de la fractura am tres envolucios o quatre, e quant mays tu te alonhas am liament del loc de la fractura, la tua strictura sia menor e pus leugiera e pus molha.	 "And then begin with a strong binding in the middle over the spot of the fracture with three or four turns, and the more you approach the spot of the fracture, your binding should be smaller, lighter, and moister.
E aprop exten a doas extremitatz del fiel a las partidas dejos entro que pervengua a la cavilha del pe, e strenh amdoas las extremitatz de las stelhas del autra part per so que·l liament no sia remaugut del sieu loc.	 Here's the translation of the given sentence:
E aprop leyssa la strectura sobre aquel, don esta ayssi que no accideys al membre corrosio ni apostema caut ni emflacio e semblantz ad aquels; e si accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, adonc cueta te am desliament de lu, e rectifica aquo que accideys tot aprop, segon que havem dit motas veguadas.	 And then release the bandage from that area, so that it does not cause corrosion, aposteme, inflammation or similar conditions on the member; and if any of these conditions occur, then count yourself with an amputation of it, and correct whatever happens as closely as possible, as we have said many times.
Mays si en le os es pessa del os la qual pongua, lahoras cove que tu engualhes aquel segon que a tu es possibla; e sino, fen sobre lu e remau aquel, e cura am aquo del qual es precedida la rememoracio entro que sia sanat.	 But if the pressure is on the bone itself, then you should remove that (pressure) as much as possible; and if not, apply a compress to it and leave it there, and treat with whatever is remembered from before until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es strenhuda aquesta fractura de la coyssa otra aquo que sian ajustadas a lu stelhas, ayssi cum havem dit en le adjutori e·n le bras.	 And sometimes this fracture of the thigh is strengthened by other things being adjusted to it, as we have said in the arm and in the hand.
Mays empero en la restauracio de lu en tal manieyra fayta no accideys al malaute claudicacio; e si es restaurada sola, otra aquo que li sia applicada l’autra camba, lahoras es necessari que claudique aquel del qual es tostemps.	 But nevertheless, in its restoration done in this way, the patient does not experience limping; and if it is restored alone or if the other leg is applied to it, then it is necessary that the one who has always limped continues to do so.
E sapias que la coyssa es strenhuda en xl dias o un pauc mes o un pauc mens, e tot aquo es segon la diversitat de las compleccios e de las autras dispozicios.	 And know that the thigh is strengthened in forty days or a little more or less, and all this is according to the diversity of complexions and other dispositions.
Capitol .xv.	 Capitulo XV (Chapter XV)
De restauracio de la fractura de la rodela del denolh.	 On restoring the dislocated hip joint.
Sapias que fractura de la rodela del denol tart endeve, mays accideys a lu motas veguadas atrissio.	 Know that the dislocation of the hip joint often happens gradually, but it can also occur suddenly.
Mays si accideys a lu fractura, lahoras no es sino fissura o trauc en las suas partidas, e aquo es am plagua o ses plagua, e sobre aquo tot es estat am le sentiment.	 But if it is a dislocation, then it is only a fracture or crack in its parts, and this is either with pain or without pain, and everything depends on the feeling.
E la restauracio de lu es enayssi que sia engualat aquo que es romput de las partidas de lu am les ditz entro que sia agreguat e conjongit segon que es possible per equacio e facilitat e fabricacio.	 And the restoration of it is such that what is broken from its parts should be made equal with those mentioned until it is joined and united as much as possible by equality, facility, and craftsmanship.
E aprop pausa emplastre e pausa sobre aquel stela redonda, si indigeysses de aquela; e strenh desus am strictura ad aquo convenient.	 Then place a plaster and place it on that round bone, if necessary; and strengthen it with a bandage as appropriate.
E aprop considera totas las disposicios las quals havem recomtadas en las autras fracturas, ayssi cum es apostema caut e semblant ad aquels enaissi que se oppause a tot accident am aquo que a lu es convenient entro que sia sanat.	 And also consider all the dispositions that we have recommended for other fractures, such as caution with inflammation and similar things, so that nothing happens to it by accident until it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	 Capítulo XVI (Chapter XVI)
De restauracio de la fractura de la camba.	 On restoring the dislocated thigh bone.
Sapias que en la camba so dos osses dels quals la un es gros, e es le nompnat per nom de la camba; e l’autra es subtil, e es nompnat focil.	 Know that in the thigh there are two bones, one of which is large and is called the femur; the other is thin and is called the fibula. ️
E accideys a quascus de las specias de fractura aquo que accideys als dos osses del bras, e per aquo es fayta restauracio de lu ayssi cum restauracio del bras engualment, e la operacio de lu es una.	 Here's the translation of the given sentence:
E si so trincatz dos osses ensemps, la camba es convertida a totas partidas.	 And if two bones are broken together, then the leg is reduced to parts.
E si es trinquat le os pus subtil, la camba es convertida a las partidas Denant.	 And if the bone is broken more finely, then the leg is reduced to the front parts.
E si es trincat le os pus gros, atrobas aquel dejos, e es de aquelas causas que no so a tu ameguadas.	 And if the bone is broken thicker, you will find it below, and this is one of those cases that are not familiar to you.
E aprop aministra extencio e equacio e liguacio de las astelas segon aquel engualment.	 Then administer extension, equilibrium, and ligament tying according to the same principle.
Mays empero cove, si la fractura de la camba es laja havent motas satagias, que la extencio sia mendre e pus leugiera, e alleuja am la tua vertut.	 However, it is necessary, if the leg fracture is jagged and has many splinters, that the extension be less and lighter, and relieve with your skill.
E en la camba es alcuna causa de operacio sobre le bras, e es quan tu engualas las stelhas e que comples tota la tieua operacio, lahoras tu prendras pessas de fustz de pi le qual es pausat dejos las cauzas las quals so pausades en solies, e so faytas eyssament de brancas de palma; aligeys de aquelas a las quals es petita groceza, e no sia ges de las manudas, e sia la longuesa de aquelas segon la longuesa de la camba, e del denol entro al pus dejos.	 And if there is any occasion to operate on the arm due to a similar cause, and when you have aligned the splinters and completed the entire operation, then take wooden sticks that are placed below the cushions that are placed under the sole, and they are made of palm branches; choose those with small thickness, not being too thick, and let their length be according to the length of the arm, and insert them from within outwards.
E aprop envolopa sobre quascuna drap en doas envolucios segon la longitut de lu, e pausa la una sobre la partida de la camba de la una part e l’autra del autra part, e sian del denol entro al pus bas loc del pe.	 Then wrap each in a cloth in two layers according to its length, and place one on the broken part of the leg on one side and the other on the opposite side, and let them be from within outwards to the lowest part of the foot.
E aprop lias las doas stelhas en tres locs de doas extremitatz e al mieg loc, quar am aquesta strectura la camba es prohibida de clinar a la partida dextra e sinistra, e sta per bona stacio.	 And then you place the two splints in three places: at both ends and in the middle, because with this structure the leg is prevented from tilting to the right or left side, and it remains stable.
E ja es aministrat un brasset de fust segon la longuesa de la camba; e sia pausada en lu la camba per so que conserve aquel de movement.	 And then a splint made of wood is administered according to the length of the leg, and the leg is placed on it so that it retains its stability.
E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	 And it is particularly important that you do this in the case of a fracture, and when there is significant injury present.
E aprop considera en quascun jorn la camba e studia am aquel per derier studi, e tu le guardes de apostema e de imflacio o de autres causas semblantz; e cum accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, lahoras opausa te a lu am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	 And then you should observe the leg daily and study it closely for any changes, ensuring that there is no pus or swelling or other similar issues; if such an issue arises, then treat it with what is necessary until it heals.
Capitol .xvii.	 Chapter 17.
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	 Of the fracture of the ankle and the bones of the foot and toes.
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	 The ankle does not fracture entirely; rather, the bones of the foot sometimes fracture; and the toes of the foot rarely fracture, and they only suffer bruising in most cases.
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.	 And if the bones of the foot are fractured and they find themselves raised above each other, then instruct the patient to place their foot on the ground as if they were walking.
E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	 Based on the given context and similarity to Latin, Italian, Spanish, and French, here's a line-by-line translation of the provided sentence:
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	 And then place a plaster and cloth on top of it, and place under the foot a small board with two flat surfaces.
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	 And then strengthen it by extending the foot, since you have wrapped it with cloth and other necessary materials.
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	 And when three or four days have passed, then you should remove the bandage, for you will find that the bones are either swollen, or bent, or dislocated, and the treatment for these is as follows:
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	 However, if some bones are bent, then you should restore those and swell those as I have recommended to you in the restoration of the fingers of the hand.
E aprop pausa al dit trincat stela segon la longitut del dit, e sia pus lada de lu un pauc; e aprop dejos le pe aquesta taula la qual e a tu recomtada, e strenh aquela am strictura decent.	 And then place a splint on the bent toe according to its length and slightly wider than it; and then under the foot the previously mentioned board, and strengthen it with appropriate traction.
Mays si aquo que es trincat dels osses so dos o tres o mays, lahoras tu pausa sobre quascun dit astela de la sua quantitat envolopada en drap leon, e strenh la taula en le pus bas del pe, e sia stant sobre la un dels caps de la taula foro le ventre del pe per que la tengua am bona retencio.	 However, if that which is bent in the bones are two or three or more, then you should place on each toe a splint of its quantity wrapped in linen cloth; and strengthen the board at the sole of the foot, with one end of the board under the arch of the foot so that it holds it well.
E es convenient a tu que no oblides que no consideres totas las causas las quals que e ditas a tu en las autras fracturas dels accidentz que havem dit; e opausa te a tot accident am aquo que cove.	 And it is advisable for you to remember that you do not neglect to consider all the causes mentioned in other accidents that we have discussed; and be prepared for any accident with what is necessary.
Capitol .xviii.	 ### Chapter XVIII
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	 ### Of the Fracture of the Pelvis of a Woman and the Bones of the Penis and Testicles of a Man
Quan le conh de la femna es trincat, lahoras fay aquela ceser en cezela cayrada, e aprop enclina aquela a la partida del dos un petit, e sia tenguda detras.	 ### When the woman's pelvis is broken, then make her sit in a chair that has been lowered, and next incline her a little to one side of her back, and let someone hold her from behind.
E aprop la matrona umpla le conh de coto, e sia fayt en le conh de lu ayssi cum spera; e aprop la femna sia concutida, e eleva le dos de lu petit a petit, quar tot aquo es fora-getat entro que sia denant la partida del conh ayssi cum spera e l’os trincat retorna.	 ### Then the midwife should fill the pelvis with cotton, and it should be done in her pelvis like this; and then the woman should be shaken, and her back should be raised little by little, because all of this is forgotten until the broken bone returns to its place as shown and the fracture heals. 》
E aprop pausa pulvils sobre le dos de lu, e quan vol urinar remaugua le coto am facilitat e aprop urine, e reduzeys e retorna aquel segon la manieyra segon la qual mezist aquel al comensament, e aprop retorne al sieu pulvil primier.	 ### Then place poultices on her back, and when she wishes to urinate, remove the cotton with ease, and then she should urinate; after that, replace it and return to the manner in which you placed it at the beginning, and then return to her first pillow.
E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	 ### And do this for seven days or thereabouts, because by then it will be healed.
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna. E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	 Then it should be filled with cotton and remain in place for several days as we have recommended, until the patient is healed.

De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	 On the treatment of nodes that occur due to a fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	 It often happens that this node occurs in the trace of a fracture, and it is particularly common near the joints, as it takes on the shape of the member; and very easily it prevents the member from its natural function.

And allow the extraction to not be loosened for several days; and then loosen it and replace another one, until the swelling is reduced; or press firmly on that lead plate, because lead has the property of removing all inflammation in the limbs.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat. De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	 Chapter 21: On the restoration of a fracture, when it has been restored and the limb is still weak and frail, not according to its natural state.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	 When a bone fracture has been restored, and the limb still remains weak and frail, this is not due to a single cause but rather to multiple causes: one of which is excessive loosening or tightening of the bandages that was not done as needed; or due to excess tightness of the bandages until the nourishment cannot reach the limb; or due to excessive superfluous wrapping; or due to unnecessary movement at the wrong time; or due to lack of blood in the patient's body and their overall weakness.

And then place the hand on the member, so that the hand draws to it a little nourishment, or continuous irrigation with warm water, until the nourishment flows and returns to its natural shape.
Capitol .xxii.	 Chapter 22.
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	 About the treatment of broken bones when they are misaligned and the operation is forbidden because it is harmful.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	 When the member that has been restored begins to heal from misalignment and protrusion of the broken bone and knot, and it is because of the swelling of the member's shape, however, the member is not forbidden its natural operation. Therefore, you should not accept the word of someone who believes that member is newly broken.

However, there have been foolish doctors and restorers who have done this in our land; and this operation is very contemptible, leading to great fear, the sign of which is deadly.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio. E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	 And sometimes it is dissolved with persistent light friction using moist hands, while also administering movement of the limb in all directions at all hours.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	 But if the curvature has already advanced and is firmly established, becoming calcified and requiring treatment with a needle, then it must be carefully perforated, and the continuity of the bone must be dissolved. The superfluous material caused by this condition should be cut away with fine scissors, and ease should be administered to the patient with due care and diligence.
Capitol .xxiii.	 Chapter .xxiii.
De sermo en dislocacio.	 On speech and dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	 Dislocation is the displacement of any of the joints from their proper position, preventing movement and distorting the figure of the limb, causing great pain and injury to the patient.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	 Therefore, when a dislocation occurs, it is necessary to immediately puncture and reduce it, without delaying the reduction; for if it is delayed, the site becomes swollen and difficult to reduce, making the treatment of the dislocation very difficult.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	 And for this reason, it is not advisable to move or extend the limb during the swelling, as excessive movement causes cramps and intense pain.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	 When this happens, it is necessary for you to resort to the phlebotomy of the patient, and immediately let out some blood so that the abscess can rest; then wrap the affected member in warm water and oil, and then reduce it with ease.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	 And let every member be treated with the same water from which the memory will return to its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	 And I have already ordered the chapters on dislocation following the same order as in fracture, from the highest part of the body to the lowest.
Capitol .xxiiii.	 Chapter 24.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	 Of the treatment for dislocation of the lower jaw.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	 When both jaws are dislocated at the same time; and this dislocation occurs in two ways: either they are slightly removed from their places and somewhat softened, or they are completely dislocated until they are softened at the joint, to the point that saliva flows from the patient's mouth and he cannot hold it or close his mouth, and his tongue is wrapped in his word.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	 But when the dislocation is minor, it usually returns to its place on its own with little effort.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	 "However, if the dislocation is complete and total, then a gentle reduction should be administered immediately, without delaying at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	 "And the assistant should hold the head of the patient, while the doctor inserts his thumb into the dislocated jaw from one side with one hand, or both thumbs together if the dislocation is on both sides, and the other fingers should be placed outside, gripping; and command the patient to cease moving their jaws and let them return to their proper place; and the doctor should grip the jaw and push it back until it returns to its original position.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	 "And if the reduction is difficult, especially if both jaws are dislocated at the same time, then administer fumigation with hot water and oil until a gentle reduction of both is achieved, without delaying the reduction of both at all, as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	 "And when they return and are gripped, and the patient's mouth is closed and not softened, then place powdered cloth with wax over them, made of wax and rose oil; and then bind it gently with soft bandages.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	 And let the patient sleep on their back, with their head between two pillows, so that they do not move to the right or the left; and do not force them to chew anything; let their food be softened lion [meat], until the pains have subsided and the jaws are loosened, then let them eat whatever they want.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	 And let this be administered with ease, and do not work on the opening of the mouth during eating, drinking, or speaking until the jaw is loosened and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	 And if it is difficult to reduce the two jaws when they are dislocated and have not returned to their proper place, then frequent fevers and cold water occur, and very easily raise the stomach of the patient, and very easily cause pure vomiting.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	 And when you see this, then know that it is fatal; and most often the one to whom this happens dies within ten days.
Capitol .xxv.	 Chapter XXV
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	 Of the reduction of the dislocation of the collarbone and the tip of the shoulder muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	 The collarbone is not dislocated from within by its connection with the feet; and sometimes it is dislocated to the outside, and this is evident to touch.
